page.title: 13Education in Alderney II
page.content: The childen who go to Guernsey are educated at either the States Grammar School or at one of the Public Schools there.The majority stay on Alderney though to continue their education.At the age of 15 children may leave school or they can stay on for C.S.E and O level exams.If they wish to continue their education they must leave the island. In recent years the Brecque School was the only alternative on Alderney to the States school.It closed in 1971 through lack of support.It now operates a pre-school group and also helps children after school hours. There is also a pre-school group run by volunteers that operates in the Island Hall.
